text: Croydon Central constituency (orange) within the London Borough of Croydon (yellow) New Addington North is a ward in the London Borough of Croydon, covering part of the New Addington estate in London in the United Kingdom. The ward currently forms part of the Croydon Central constituency. The population Fieldway ward at the 2011 Census was 11,479. The ward returns two councillors every four years to Croydon Council. At the 2006 London local elections Simon Hall and Carole Bonner were elected to the council, for the previous Fieldway ward. They stood as Labour candidates, winning with a small margin over the British National Party. == List of Councillors == {|class="wikitable" |- !Election !colspan="2"|Councillor!! Party !colspan="2"|Councillor!!
